Argument 1
----------

Fit linear regression weighted by population.

```{r a1m1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, comment=NA}
summary(lm(d$homicides_per_100000~d$firearms_per_100, weights=d$population))
```

Firearms are not statistically significant. Gross domestic product (at purchasing power parity) per capita can be a strong confounding variable, so fit another regression.

```{r a1m2, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, comment=NA}
summary(lm(d$homicides_per_100000~d$firearms_per_100+d$gdp_ppp_per_capita, weights=d$population))
```

Even after controlling for GDP (PPP) per capita, firearms are still not statistically significant, therefore **the effect of firearms on homicide, if it exists, must be small**.

Argument 2
----------

Number of firearms and homicide rate are not normally distributed. Transform them by taking the log, then fit linear regression weighted by population:

```{r a2m1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, comment=NA}
summary(lm(log(d$homicides_per_100000)~log(d$firearms_per_100), weights=d$population))
```

Firearms are statistically significant and have positive coefficient in the regression, therefore **more firearms means more homicide**.

Argument 3
----------

Fit linear regression weighted by number of homicides. Exclude countries with gross domestic product (at purchasing power parity) per capita lower than the median because we are primarily interested in developed countries. 

```{r a3m1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, comment=NA, highlight=TRUE}
s <- d[d$gdp_ppp_per_capita > median(d$gdp_ppp_per_capita),]
summary(lm(s$homicides_per_100000~s$firearms_per_100, weights=as.numeric(s$population)*s$homicides_per_100000))
```

Firearms are statistically significant and have negative coefficient in the regression, therefore **more firearms means less homicide**.

Data Sources
------------

* Intentional homicide rates per 100,000 population as of 2012,
  *Global Study on Homicide 2013*
  https://www.unodc.org/gsh/

* Total population as of 2012,
  *The World Bank*
  http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL

* GDP, PPP as of 2012,
  *The World Bank* 
  http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.CD

* Firarms per 100 population,
  *2007 Small Arms Survey*
  http://www.smallarmssurvey.org
